fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data

Interface IData<T extends IType>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of data in the cell.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IArrayData, IBinaryData, IBooleanData, IDateData, IDateTimeData, IDecimalData, IFloatData, IImageData, IIntegerData, IRelationData, ITextData, ITimeData, IUuidData

    public interface IData<T extends IType>
    Data for a specific cell in a specific item.

    Thread-safety: implementations of this interface are not required to be safe for concurrent access. Therefore, processing should generally not be shared between multiple threads.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<?> getAutoFillValues(IUser forUser)
      Gets the list of current auto-fill values that can be applied to this cell, if any, for the specified user.
      ICell getCell()
      Gets the cell with which the data is associated.
      IDataStructure getContainer()
      Gets the data structure (such as an item or an array) with which the data is associated.
      T getType()
      Convenience method for retrieving the data type of the cell.
      Object getValue()
      Gets the current value of this cell data.
      boolean isModified()
      Indicates whether or not this data has been modified since being fetched.
      boolean isNull()
      Indicates if the current value of this cell data is NULL.
      boolean isReadOnly()
      Indicates whether this data should allow modifications.
      boolean isRequired()
      Indicates whether this data is required.
      boolean isVisible()
      Indicates whether this data should be made visible.
      void setValue(Object value)
      Sets the current value of this cell data.

    • Method Detail

      • getContainer

        IDataStructure getContainer()
        Gets the data structure (such as an item or an array) with which the data is associated. The item may be for example a database record.
        Returns:
        the non-null item.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getCell

        ICell getCell()
        Gets the cell with which the data is associated.
        Returns:
        the cell, which defines the type of value and provides access to the data source.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getType

        T getType()
        Convenience method for retrieving the data type of the cell. This yields identical results to getCell().getType().
        Returns:
        the data type of the cell.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getValue()

      • isNull

        boolean isNull()
        Indicates if the current value of this cell data is NULL.
        Returns:
        true if the current value is NULL, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getValue

        Object getValue()
        Gets the current value of this cell data.
        Returns:
        the value, possibly null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getType(), setValue(Object), isModified(), isVisible(), isNull()

      • setValue

        void setValue(Object value)
        Sets the current value of this cell data.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value, possibly null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is of the wrong type, or fails to meet validation requirements or comply with auto-fill restrictions.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getType(), getValue(), isModified(), isReadOnly(), isRequired()

      • getAutoFillValues

        List<?> getAutoFillValues(IUser forUser)
        Gets the list of current auto-fill values that can be applied to this cell, if any, for the specified user. This list may be filtered by the current value. It may be temporarily undefined if the current value does not allow the list to be efficiently or sufficiently filtered, or if the list of values is retrieved asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        forUser - the user for which the values are required.
        Returns:
        a list of values, possibly empty. If the cell does not define an auto-fill provider, then this will return null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isModified

        boolean isModified()
        Indicates whether or not this data has been modified since being fetched.
        Returns:
        true if the data has been updated, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IItem.isModified()

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Indicates whether this data should be made visible. This can be based on permissions, on arbitrary business rules, or on model constraints. The visible state may change dynamically.
        Returns:
        true if the value is allowed to be made visible, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isReadOnly(), getValue()

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Indicates whether this data should allow modifications. This can be based on permissions, on arbitrary business rules, or on model constraints. The read-only state may change dynamically.

        Note: this is an advisory attribute; it should be applied to the user interface, but it is not necessarily enforced by the API (this makes it possible to protect the data value from arbitrary end user modifications, without preventing code-based modifications using the API). Changes to the data value may however trigger ItemStoreException when storing the item containing the data.

        Returns:
        true if the value is allowed to be modified, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isVisible(), setValue(Object)

      • isRequired

        boolean isRequired()
        Indicates whether this data is required. This can be based on permissions, on arbitrary business rules, or on model constraints. The required state may change dynamically.
        Returns:
        true if the value is required, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        setValue(Object)
